oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard from Pvt. Joseph W. Knox to his mother
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Joseph William Knox wrote this postcard, featuring a color photograph of the lobby of The Tutwiler Hotel in Birmingham, Alabama, to his mother in Dyer, Tennessee. He said the Red Cross had served breakfast and he had never felt better in his life. Knox was on his way to Camp Gordon, Georgia, for training. He served in Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt. in the Meuse-Argonne offensive. He was honorably discharged on July 31, 1919. [See also GWjack018-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
